name: twittered
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
twitter
twitter verb
(BIRD)
[ I ] (of a bird) to make a series of short, high sounds: I was woken up by a bird twittering just outside my window. The only sounds were the birds twittering and chirping in the trees.

See more results »
twitter verb
(PERSON)
[ I ] to talk quickly and nervously in a high voice, saying very little of importance or interest: She comes in here when I'm trying to work and just twitters on about nothing. The old ladies were twittering in the reception area.

twitter verb
(SOCIAL MEDIA)
[ I or T ] (also Twitter) to publish a short remark or piece of information on the social media service Twitter: I twittered during the race so that my girlfriend knew where I was and so that people at home could follow me. People have Twittered the birth of their children, getting into college and have even proposed marriage. Synonym
tweet
More examplesFewer examplesHe says he had an ugly run-in with a racist at the airport and twittered that he would die if he had to live in the city. They began discussing something that one of the friends Twittered that afternoon, as if picking up a conversation in the middle.We're all Twittering the same thing, trying to get as much information out there as possible.Since the show finished recording, she has been twittering on-line but makes no mention of her former beau.
